intro: Languas glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf languas, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, smooth leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Languas glabrescens is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
